News.Title: Persistent Systems Reports Strong Q2 FY26 Results with 17.6% YoY Revenue Growth and 230 bps Margin Expansion
News.Summary: Persistent Systems delivered revenue of $406.2 million in Q2 FY26, marking 4.2% quarter-on-quarter growth and 17.6% year-on-year growth. This represents the company's 22nd consecutive quarter of growth, bringing trailing 12-month revenue above $1.5 billion. EBIT margin reached 16.3%, showing 230 basis points improvement year-on-year, while profit after tax margin was 13.2%, up 45.1% year-on-year in absolute terms. The company reported total contract value of $609.2 million with new bookings at $350.8 million. Client metrics showed robust growth with top 5 clients' revenue up 23.4% year-on-year. Geographically, Europe led with 37.9% growth, followed by North America at 15.4%. BFSI sector drove industry growth at 30% year-on-year. The company implemented merit increments for all global employees effective October 1, 2025, and promoted Jaideep Dhok to Chief Operating Officer. Total headcount reached 26,224, up 884 from the previous quarter, with trailing 12-month attrition improving to 13.8%. The company continues advancing its AI strategy through three core pillars: AI for Technology, AI for Business, and Enterprise Data Readiness for AI.

News.Title: Persistent Systems Reports Record Quarterly Results with 4.2% Sequential Revenue Growth
News.Summary: Persistent Systems' stock gained 8% following its September quarter results announcement on October 14. The IT company reported sequential revenue growth of 4.2% to $406.2 million, up from 3.9% in the prior quarter. The healthcare vertical, contributing over 25% of revenue, recovered with 4% sequential growth after a 2.2% decline previously. The company achieved a record quarterly operating margin of 16.3%, supported by 80 basis points from software license cost reversal, 60 basis points from currency benefits, and 20 basis points from increased offshoring. Record order bookings reached $609.2 million, primarily driven by renewal projects. Employee count increased by 884 to 26,224, while attrition remained stable at 13.8%. The company maintains its $2 billion revenue target by FY27 and expects double-digit growth for FY26. Salary revisions implemented from October 1 are expected to impact margins by 80-100 basis points. Motilal Oswal projects 19% revenue and 26% earnings growth between FY25-FY27, maintaining a buy rating with Rs6,550 target price.

News.Title: Persistent Systems Shares Surge 7% After Strong Q2 Results Trigger Bullish Brokerage Calls
News.Summary: Persistent Systems reported strong quarterly results with consolidated net profit jumping 45% to ₹471.5 crore and revenue from operations growing 23.5% to ₹3,580.7 crore. The company's board approved the transfer of 100% shareholding of Aepona Group Ltd, Ireland. Multiple brokerages responded positively with upgraded target prices: CLSA raised its target to ₹8,270 with an outperform rating, Nuvama increased to ₹7,000 with a buy rating, and Motilal Oswal maintained a buy at ₹6,550 projecting 19% USD revenue CAGR over FY25-27. The stock surged over 7% to an intraday high of ₹5,728.90, trading at ₹5,692.70, up 6.91% from the previous close of ₹5,324.25.

News.Title: Persistent Systems Sets $2 Billion Revenue Target by FY27 with Margin Expansion Plans

News.Title: Persistent Systems Reports Strong Q2 Results with Net Profit Rising to 4.71 Billion Rupees
News.Summary: Persistent Systems delivered quarterly results that exceeded estimates across key metrics. Net profit increased to 4.71 billion rupees from 4.25 billion rupees in the previous quarter, surpassing the estimated 4.36 billion rupees. Revenue grew to 35.8 billion rupees from 33.3 billion rupees quarter-on-quarter, slightly above the 35.21 billion rupees estimate. EBIT rose to 5.83 billion rupees from 5.19 billion rupees, beating the estimated 5.52 billion rupees. The company's EBIT margin improved to 16.28% from 15.57% in the previous quarter, exceeding the estimated 15.7%.

News.Title: Persistent Systems Approves Transfer of Aepona Group Limited from US Subsidiary to Parent Company
News.Summary: Persistent Systems Limited's Board of Directors approved the transfer of 100% shareholding of Aepona Group Limited, Ireland, from its subsidiary Persistent Systems Inc., USA to the parent company. The restructuring aims to achieve entity rationalization and operational efficiency within the group. Following the transfer, Aepona Group Limited will become a wholly owned subsidiary of Persistent Systems Limited. The company stated there are no benefits to promoters or group companies from this proposed restructuring. The transfer will be executed through a Share Purchase Agreement.

News.Title: Persistent Systems Says U.S. H-1B Visa Executive Order Won't Significantly Impact Operations

The company reviewed the Executive Order titled 'Restriction on Entry of Certain Non-Immigrant Workers' and a subsequent memorandum issued by U.S. immigration authorities. Persistent Systems stated it will continue monitoring developments and provide updates as needed.

News.Title: Persistent Systems Receives Improved ESG Rating of 81.7 for FY 2024-25

This represents an increase of 4.3 points from the previous fiscal year FY 2023-24. The assessment was based on the company's Annual Report, ESG Report for FY 2024-25, ESG-related web page, and other publicly available information. SES ESG Research is a wholly owned subsidiary of Stakeholders Empowerment Services.

News.Title: Persistent Systems Wins 'Growth Honor of the Year' at 2025 Everest Group Elevate Honors
News.Summary: Persistent Systems has been awarded the 'Growth Honor of the Year' at the 2025 Everest Group Elevate Honors, recognizing companies with annual revenue between $1-5 billion. The award acknowledges Persistent's market-leading organic, constant-currency revenue growth among publicly listed global service providers. The company has achieved 21 sequential quarters of revenue growth and reported $1,470.7 million in trailing twelve-month revenue as of Q1 FY26. Persistent delivered a 25.6% four-year CAGR from FY21-FY25 and a 17.4% CAGR since its 2010 IPO. The company has provided a five-year shareholder return of 1,805.2%. CEO Sandeep Kalra stated the recognition affirms client trust and highlighted the company's AI-led, platform-driven services strategy as growth drivers. Persistent aims to become a $5 billion company by FY31.

News.Title: Persistent Systems Appoints Jaideep Dhok as COO-Technology Following Dhanashree Bhat's Resignation
News.Summary: Persistent Systems announced leadership changes in its operations team. Dhanashree Bhat stepped down from her position as Chief Operating Officer and SMP effective August 11, 2025. Jaideep Dhok has been designated as the new Chief Operating Officer - Technology and SMP effective August 12, 2025. Dhok previously served as Senior Vice President for Banking, Financial Services and Insurance at the company and brings over 23 years of experience across horizontal technologies and the BFSI industry. He has spent over 14 years at Persistent, leading major transformation programs and expanding the company's BFSI segment. In his new role, Dhok will take on additional responsibilities including Delivery Excellence, Talent Acquisition/Talent Management, Learning and Development, and Alliances and Partnerships. He also leads the APAC region and contributes to the company's AI strategy.
